item.title: Biogen beats estimates on cost cuts and new drugs like Leqembi, but profit outlook falls short
item.description: Biogen expects Leqembi and new rare disease and depression treatments to help offset revenue lost from multiple sclerosis products.

item.title: Lyft shares sink 7% on underwhelming fourth-quarter results
item.description: Lyft shares shed about 7% after the ride-sharing app reported lackluster fourth-quarter results and weak bookings guidance due to rising competition.

item.title: Restaurant Brands reports 2.5% same-store sales growth, fueled by Burger King and Popeyes
item.description: Restaurant Brands' revenue climbed 26% in the quarter.

item.title: CVS shares pop 15% on big earnings beat, even as high medical costs drag down insurance unit
item.description: It caps off the first full quarter with David Joyner, a longtime CVS executive, as CEO of the troubled retail drugstore chain.

item.title: SoftBank posts surprise loss of $2.4 billion in third quarter as Vision Fund investments go into red
item.description: SoftBank Group posted a surprise quarterly loss Wednesday and the Japanese company's revenue also missed analysts' estimates.
